title: Discord Movie Bot
text:
Overview
Two years ago, this was my first interaction with Docker, APIs, and JSON parsing. While tedious, the satisfaction of getting each step to work up until the final product confirmed to me that data science is what I love. Since then, I have not worked with Docker or APIs much as my focus has shifted towards machine learning, making this post a neat refresher for me.


Setup
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 10 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()




Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: About Me
text:
Welcome to my data science blog! My name is Nick Kalenichenko, and I recently graduated from the University of Virginia with my Master’s in Data Science. This September, I am excited to embark on my professional journey as a forensic data analyst in Charlotte, NC.
To me, data science is the intersection of continuous learning, creativity, and problem solving. In my experience, articulating the process of a data science project reinforces the knowledge learned through the project, enabling a deeper understanding of the material. This is why I have made this website, so I hope you find content you enjoy. Feel free to reach out to me using any of the links up above.
